text: culturally I think it's been a very very
rich experience within the boundaries of
Harvard Business School is literally
like meeting the world everyday because
we have students from so many other
countries from Asia Africa Russia so you
get to interact with people from diverse
cultures and backgrounds well I think
the central goal of teaching is to help
your students along the path of life to
help them along to be successful to be
the best they can be
so that means keeping your eye on
several kind of points of triangulation
one is what's happening in the world how
is the world changing what's the world
your students are going to step into
another is what's happening in the world
knowledge what do we know what are we
learning what is research telling us a
third is what's happening in your
students lives where are they what do
they already know what do they need to
know where is their personal development
and taking these three and it pieces
together and triangulating them in a way
that you can try to deliver to the
student what the student needs to know
and to develop in order to be better at
the right time is sort of the art of
teaching I would also emphasize that I
put a strong very high value myself on
the role of challenging questions
questions that will challenge students
not only about what they know or they
don't know but will challenge their
deepest assumptions about the role
they're going to occupy and helping
students while they're here not only
gather knowledge develop skills but also
develop a basic or at least a framework
of their own personal philosophy of
Management that they can take out into
the world is an important part of the
educational mission that I bring into
the classroom it's so easy to just
immerse yourself in a different culture
here whether it be in the classroom
outside the classroom literally on
campus with different cultural events to
understand how ephemeral that world is
to understand how how sensitive it is to
change to recognize that the
globalization we take for granted really
requires a Khan
collection of adjustments on the part of
both managers and policymakers to make
sure that people still feel like they
benefit from it to make sure that indeed
they do benefit from it is really I
think essential to being an effective
leader in either an organization like
the World Bank or a major corporation or
to set up a new company to fit within
this institutional architecture for
market the borrowing costs within Turkey
are what we do here is we teach people
the ability to see the whole to see how
the world hangs together to see how the
economy hangs together how firms relate
to other firms but also to government to
society to the institutions of
capitalism to cross-border flows of
goods and people and services and
capital to really how things hang
together in a very big picture sense
